moves.1. e4: Hi everyone, this is another Annotations Project victory for me against my buddy Nick.  I will start the action on move 8 where black moved his king to e8.
moves.1... c5 2. f4 d5 3. Nf3 dxe4 4. Ng5 Nf6: 9. Bxg4 - I decide to get rid of the knight here.
moves.9... Qd6 10. O-O: 10. 0-0 - tucks Henry out of the way and protects my f pawn.
moves.10... h6 11. Ne6: 11. Ne6 - trying to create a cramp.
moves.11... h5 12. Bh3: 12. Bh3 - maintaining protection of the e6 knight.
moves.12... Rh6 13. f5 g6: 13. ...... g6?? - a bad move, this will open the f file and I will make very good use of it to ensure I win the black dsb.
moves.15... Kd7 16. Rd8+: 16. Rd8+ - that rook espies bigger booty - the Wicked Witch of the West!
moves.16... Kc6 17. Rxd6+ Kxd6 18. Nc3: 18. Nc3 - After dealing with the Wicked Witch I now consolidate and develop my second knight.  After black's next move, however, 18....... Ke5 I land a coup de grace with my horsie jumping on to c7.  The rook on a8 is toast and Scalawag waves that white flag!  I am now about to go away on holiday to sunny Cornwall for two weeks, returning on 28th August!  I will be back to annotate more games then but it is cheers and bye for now from me, Joanne.

gameName: The Annotation Project - Making use of Open Lines
